1017770088416661504.text: People often ask me how they can get started with #Ethereum or related technologies. I just realized how I do it... I try to break it! If it doesn't break, try to understand why. If it does break, try to fix it. IMHO this is the only way to truly understand the core concepts.

986713926074331136.text: Kinda proud of this one :) I've just created an auto-updating fork of #ipfs that's not based on the #gx package manager. Ie. you can use IPFS from your plain #golang code. It plays nice with `go get`, you can `govendor` it, there's even full #godoc!  https://github.com/ipsn/go-ipfs

990400833664770050.text:
What I want from blockchain games:

1) be a good game first
2) explore what makes blockchain unique
3) design around the limitations
4) persistent always on world 
5) players own the game, the items and experiences
6) allow anyone to design and improve the game
7) embrace bots
